Detailed Description

A single streaming sound (OGG).

Handles playing a sound from an ogg stream.

Definition at line 46 of file OgreOggStreamSound.h.

Plays the sound.

Remarks:

00117                 switch(mVorbisInfo->channels)
00118                 {

00120                         {
00121                                 mFormat = AL_FORMAT_MONO16;
00122                                 // Set BufferSize to 250ms (Frequency * 2 (16bit) divided by 4 (quarter of a second))
00123                                 mBufferSize = mVorbisInfo->rate >> 1;
00124                                 // IMPORTANT : The Buffer Size must be an exact multiple of the BlockAlignment ...
00125                                 mBufferSize -= (mBufferSize % 2);

00134                                 mBufferSize -= (mBufferSize % 4);
00135                         }
00136                         break;

00179                         Ogre::LogManager::getSingleton().logMessage("!!WARNING!! Could not determine buffer format!  Defaulting to MONO");

void OgreOggSound::OgreOggStreamSound::_stopImpl (  )  [protected, virtual]

Stops playing sound.

Remarks:
Stops playing audio immediately and resets playback. If specified to do so its source will be released also.

Implements OgreOggSound::OgreOggISound.

bool OgreOggSound::OgreOggStreamSound::_stream ( ALuint  buffer  )  [protected]

Loads data from the stream into a buffer.

Remarks:
Reads a specified chunk of data from the file stream into a designated buffer object.
Parameters:
buffer id to load data into.

This is the closest we can get to a loop trigger. If, whilst filling the buffers, we need to wrap the stream pointer, trigger the loop callback if defined. NOTE:- The accuracy of this method will be affected by a number of parameters, namely the buffer size, whether the sound has previously given up its source (therefore it will be re-filling all buffers, which, if the sound was close to eof will likely get triggered), and the quality of the sound, lower quality will hold a longer section of audio per buffer. In ALL cases this trigger will happen BEFORE the audio audibly loops!!

Definition at line 280 of file ogreoggstreamsound.cpp.

void OgreOggSound::OgreOggStreamSound::_updateAudioBuffers (  )  [protected, virtual]

Updates the data buffers with sound information.

Remarks:
This function refills processed buffers with audio data from the stream, it automatically handles looping if set.

Implements OgreOggSound::OgreOggISound.

00230                 if (mSource == AL_NONE || !mPlay) return;
00231 
00232                 ALenum state;
00233                 alGetSourcei(mSource, AL_SOURCE_STATE, &state);
00234 
00235                 if (state == AL_PAUSED) return;
00236 
00237                 // Ran out of buffer data?
00238                 if (state == AL_STOPPED)
00239                 {
00240                         if(mStreamEOF)
00241                         {
00242                                 stop();
00243                                 // Finished callback
00244                                 if ( mFinishedCB && mFinCBEnabled )
00245                                         mFinishedCB->execute(static_cast<OgreOggISound*>(this));
00246                                 return;
00247                         }
00248                         else
00249                         {
00250                                 // Clear audio data already played...
00251                                 _dequeue();
00252 
00253                                 // Fill with next chunk of audio...
00254                                 _prebuffer();
00255 
00256                                 // Play...
00257                                 alSourcePlay(mSource);
00258                         }

00260

00262

00264 
00265                 while(processed--)
00266                 {
00267                         ALuint buffer;
00268 
00269                         alSourceUnqueueBuffers(mSource, 1, &buffer);
00270                         if ( _stream(buffer) ) alSourceQueueBuffers(mSource, 1, &buffer);
00271                 }
00272

00274                 if ( mPlayPosChanged ) 
00275                 {
00276                         _updatePlayPosition();
00277                 }

void OgreOggSound::OgreOggStreamSound::_updatePlayPosition (  )  [protected]

handles a request to set the playback position within the stream

Remarks:
To ensure thread safety this function performs the request within the thread locked update function instead of 'immediate mode' for static sounds.
